page.title: 06THE VILLAGE PLAYGROUP
page.content: 1CHILDREN START PLAYGROUP WHEN THEY ARE TWO AND A HALF YEARS OLD.THE GROUP MEETS IN THE PLAYING FIELD PAVILION ON TWO MORNINGS A WEEK FOR TWO HOURS.EACH CHILD PAYS 50 PENCE PER SESSIAN.MRS MARY WATSON IS THE SUPERVISOR AND UP TO 6 MOTHERS HELP.THE HELPERS NEED TO BE HELPFUL,KIND AND GOOD LISTENERS.THE PLAYGROUP IS PART OF THE PRE-SCHOOL PLAYGROUP ASSOCIATION.IT RUN BY A COMMITTEE,WHICH DECIDES ON ACTIVITIES,APPOINTMENT OF SUPERVISOR AND FUND RAISING. THE CHILDREN LEAVE AT THE AGE OF 4 WHEN THEY CAN START SCHOOL. AT PRESENT THERE ARE 8 BOYS AND 8 GIRLS.THE CHILDREN CLIMB, CUT OUT AND ACT PLAYS,SO THEY CAN LEARN SKILLS AND BECOME MORE CONFIDENT.THEY SOMETIMES GO OUT OF THE VILLAGE ON TRIPS WITH THE PLAYGROUP.
